programme.title: Faster With Finnegan
programme.desc: The dream of long travel suspension on Roadkill's slightly modified Vette Kart finally comes true for the guys; Brad DeBerti helps them figure out how to not taco the front end as they take on a Pro2 truck on an off-road short course.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: Finnegan and Newbern give new life to a '57 Chevy Bel Air that was pulled from a junkyard after more than 30 years. The guys drop in a small-block V8 and turbo 350 to get the car back on the pavement for a bumpy road trip back to where it came from.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.sub-title: Mopar Muscle Truck Gets a Hemi!
programme.desc: Dulcich enlists Wiley Stevens and Chris Birdsong to transplant a third-generation Hemi into the 1974 Dodge D100, also known as the Mopar Muscle Truck; after issues hold up progress, the guys clean up a new project 1974 Dodge Charger.

programme.title: Faster With Finnegan
programme.sub-title: Drag Race Mustang vs. Andrade's Malibu!
programme.desc: The guys put John Andrade Jr. in a tiny truck and beat him in a mud drag race with the Dirt Track Camaro; Andrade challenges them to see what they can do with a derelict and parted-out Mustang against his 79 Chevy Malibu.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: The girls bring in a rare Caprice cop car to bolt on a supercharger from a second-generation CTS-V; they'll make brackets for the intercooler, bolt on the supercharger and give the rare cop car some extra power.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: The crew diagnoses and fixes some problems on a Dodge Avenger; they demonstrate how to know when motor mounts are bad, and how to easily fix a cracked bumper.

programme.title: Car Fix
programme.desc: Fuller and Bumpus demonstrate how to take modern design techniques like flush-mounted glass and custom drip rails and convert those elements onto a 1986 Monte Carlo.

programme.title: Car Fix
programme.desc: Bryan and Jeremy take an F-100 restoration that was supposed to be all original and switch gears; starting with a new Coyote engine and a supercharger under the hood, this project is destined for more custom touches.

programme.title: Super Street Garage
programme.desc: To kick off the show, John "Nads" Naderi and Amir Bentatou hatch a plan to afford their dream Civic Type R hatch, go way over budget and celebrate the dawn of a new era of Super Street the best way they know how: with an old-school canyon run.

programme.title: Super Street Garage
programme.sub-title: Taking a 2015 Subaru BRZ from Fun Commuter to Track-Day Hero
programme.desc: The boys get their hands on a stock Subaru BRZ; Nads and Amir add some affordable mods to turn it into a respectable track car; they try to turn a fast enough time at the track to gain entry into the exclusive sub-two-minute lap club.

programme.title: Super Street Garage
programme.sub-title: Beat Down 350Z Drift Missile to Street Shark Dripping With Style
programme.desc: "Hot Rod Garage" built a Nissan 350Z drifter with a welded differential, hydraulic handbrake, steering angle kit and not much else; then they abandoned it; Nads and Amir try to salvage this one with some much-needed style and a Formula Drift debut.

programme.title: Super Street Garage
programme.sub-title: JDM Toyota Chaser Goes From Big-Body Drifter to Quarter-Mile Dragger
programme.desc: The boys score a Japanese-spec, right-hand-drive 1997 Toyota Chaser; it's the perfect recipe for a sideways, big-body drift car, but Nads and Amir want to go in a different direction: straight down the drag strip.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: The team checks off items from a wish list for a military mother's Mustang; many repairs can be performed in a driveway with hand tools.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: The girls find some parts for a 1978 Ford Mustang and give new life to the old pony.

programme.title: Car Fix
programme.desc: Jared and Lou work on their first Dodge Viper, starting with a bolt-on supercharger with long tube headers and exhaust.

programme.title: Car Fix
programme.desc: The guys diagnose and repair a convertible top on a 1964 Lincoln Continental.

programme.title: FourWheeler
programme.desc: Since a TJ can be had for under 10K, Ian shows how to buy a Jeep on a budget and outfit it with everything needed to hit the rocks and still have money left over.

programme.title: FourWheeler
programme.desc: The Budget TJ gets some more parts; Ian updates the suspension with new coilovers; he adds new bumpers front and rear, and by the end of the day, this TJ is trail ready.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: Cars die of boredom, so it wasn't great for a Plymouth Prowler to sit in a museum for 15 years; the girls show what areas to fix before the car gets back on the road.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: The team brings back the 442 Tribute car to give it a new LS engine and finish modifying the interior for the previously-installed TKO transmission.

programme.title: Car Fix
programme.desc: Some project cars need every body panel replaced, so Fuller and Bumpus show how to work with new sheet metal panels on a 1963 Impala; they also find a running Road Runner to have some fun with.

programme.title: Car Fix
programme.desc: Fuller brings in a twin-turbo, thousand-horsepower Cutlass to do some custom fabrication and build an all-new interior.

programme.title: FourWheeler
programme.desc: Since the Bronco is back, Ian pays homage to the very cool box-style Bronco of the past. He helps with the handling by adding an upgraded suspension, and adds new bumpers for a more aggressive look. Plus, he fixes some gremlins in the inline-six mot.

programme.title: FourWheeler
programme.desc: How a factory two-door Toyota Tacoma can be made into the perfect off-road truck with the right axles and suspension.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: The girls bring in a rare Caprice cop car to bolt on a supercharger from a second-generation CTS-V; they'll make brackets for the intercooler, bolt on the supercharger and give the rare cop car some extra power.

programme.desc: The crew diagnoses and fixes some problems on a Dodge Avenger; they demonstrate how to know when motor mounts are bad, and how to easily fix a cracked bumper.

programme.desc: Fuller and Bumpus demonstrate how to take modern design techniques like flush-mounted glass and custom drip rails and convert those elements onto a 1986 Monte Carlo.
